verses.verse: בֵּלְשַׁאצַּ֣ר <S%H1113><s%> be-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar מַלְכָּ֗א <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka, the king עֲבַד֙ <S%H5648><s%> 'a-Vad made לְחֶ֣ם <S%H3900><s%> le-Chem feast רַ֔ב <S%H7229><s%> Rav, a great לְרַבְרְבָנ֖וֹהִי <S%H7261><s%> le-rav-re-va-No-hi of his lords אֲלַ֑ף <S%H506><s%> 'a-Laf; to a thousand וְלָקֳבֵ֥ל <S%H6903><s%> ve-lo-ko-Vel before אַלְפָּ֖א <S%H506><s%> 'al-Pa the thousand חַמְרָ֥א <S%H2562><s%> cham-Ra wine שָׁתֵֽה׃ <S%H8355><s%> sha-Teh. and drank

בֵּלְשַׁאצַּ֞ר <S%H1113><s%> be-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar אֲמַ֣ר׀ <S%H560><s%> 'a-Mar commanded בִּטְעֵ֣ם <S%H2939><s%> bit-'Em make to eat חַמְרָ֗א <S%H2562><s%> cham-Ra, the wine לְהַיְתָיָה֙ <S%H858><s%> le-hay-ta-Yah to bring לְמָאנֵי֙ <S%H3984><s%> le-ma-Nei vessels דַּהֲבָ֣א <S%H1722><s%> da-ha-Va the golden וְכַסְפָּ֔א <S%H3702><s%> ve-chas-Pa, and silver דִּ֤י <S%H1768><s%> di which הַנְפֵּק֙ <S%H5312><s%> han-Pek had taken נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֣ר <S%H5020><s%> ne-vu-chad-netz-Tzar Nebuchadnezzar אֲב֔וּהִי <S%H2><s%> 'a-Vu-hi, which his father מִן־ <S%H4481><s%> min- out of הֵיכְלָ֖א <S%H1965><s%> heich-La the temple דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di which בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם <S%H3390><s%> vi-ru-she-Lem; which [was] in Jerusalem וְיִשְׁתּ֣וֹן <S%H8355><s%> ve-yish-Ton might drink בְּה֗וֹן <S%H99999><s%> be-Hon, מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka that the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <S%H7261><s%> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his princes שֵׁגְלָתֵ֖הּ <S%H7695><s%> she-ge-la-Teh his wives וּלְחֵנָתֵֽהּ׃ <S%H3904><s%> u-le-che-na-Teh. and his concubines

בֵּאדַ֗יִן <S%H116><s%> be-Da-yin, Then הַיְתִיו֙ <S%H858><s%> hay-Tiv they brought מָאנֵ֣י <S%H3984><s%> ma-Nei vessels דַהֲבָ֔א <S%H1722><s%> da-ha-Va, the golden דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di which הַנְפִּ֗קוּ <S%H5312><s%> han-Pi-ku, that were taken מִן־ <S%H4481><s%> min- out of הֵֽיכְלָ֛א <S%H1965><s%> heich-La the temple דִּֽי־ <S%H1768><s%> di- which בֵ֥ית <S%H1005><s%> veit of the house אֱלָהָ֖א <S%H426><s%> 'e-la-Ha of God דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di which בִירֽוּשְׁלֶ֑ם <S%H3390><s%> vi-ru-she-Lem; which [was] at Jerusalem וְאִשְׁתִּ֣יו <S%H8355><s%> ve-'ish-Tiv drank בְּה֗וֹן <S%H99999><s%> be-Hon, מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka and the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <S%H7261><s%> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his princes שֵׁגְלָתֵ֖הּ <S%H7695><s%> she-ge-la-Teh his wives וּלְחֵנָתֵֽהּ׃ <S%H3904><s%> u-le-che-na-Teh. and his concubines

אִשְׁתִּ֖יו <S%H8355><s%> 'ish-Tiv They drank חַמְרָ֑א <S%H2562><s%> cham-Ra; wine וְ֠שַׁבַּחוּ <S%H7624><s%> Ve-shab-ba-chu and praised לֵֽאלָהֵ֞י <S%H426><s%> le-la-Hei the gods דַּהֲבָ֧א <S%H1722><s%> da-ha-Va of gold וְכַסְפָּ֛א <S%H3702><s%> ve-chas-Pa and of silver נְחָשָׁ֥א <S%H5174><s%> ne-cha-Sha of brass פַרְזְלָ֖א <S%H6523><s%> far-ze-La of iron אָעָ֥א <S%H636><s%> 'a-'A of wood וְאַבְנָֽא׃ <S%H69><s%> ve-'av-Na. and of stone

בַּהּ־ bah- שַׁעֲתָ֗ה <S%H8160><s%> sha-'a-Tah, In the same hour; נְפַקוּ ne-fa-ku כנְפַ֙קָה֙ <S%H5312><s%> ne-Fa-kah go קאֶצְבְּעָן֙ <S%H677><s%> 'etz-be-'An fingers דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di forasmuch יַד־ <S%H3028><s%> yad- hand אֱנָ֔שׁ <S%H606><s%> 'e-Nash, of a man's וְכָֽתְבָן֙ <S%H3790><s%> ve-cha-te-Van and wrote לָקֳבֵ֣ל <S%H6903><s%> lo-ko-Vel over against נֶבְרַשְׁתָּ֔א <S%H5043><s%> nev-rash-Ta, the candlestick עַל־ <S%H5922><s%> 'al- upon גִּירָ֕א <S%H1528><s%> gi-Ra the plaister דִּֽי־ <S%H1768><s%> di- forasmuch כְתַ֥ל <S%H3797><s%> che-Tal of the wall הֵיכְלָ֖א <S%H1965><s%> heich-La palace דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di forasmuch מַלְכָּ֑א <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka; of the king's וּמַלְכָּ֣א <S%H4430><s%> u-mal-Ka and the king חָזֵ֔ה <S%H2370><s%> cha-Zeh, saw פַּ֥ס <S%H6447><s%> pas the part יְדָ֖ה <S%H3028><s%> ye-Dah of the hand דִּ֥י <S%H1768><s%> di did כָתְבָֽה׃ <S%H3790><s%> cha-te-Vah. that wrote

אֱדַ֤יִן <S%H116><s%> 'e-Da-yin Then מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka the king's זִיוֹ֣הִי <S%H2122><s%> zi-Yo-hi countenance שְׁנ֔וֹהִי <S%H8133><s%> she-No-hi, was changed וְרַעיֹנֹ֖הִי <S%H7476><s%> ve-ra-'-yo-No-hi and his thoughts יְבַהֲלוּנֵּ֑הּ <S%H927><s%> ye-va-ha-lun-Neh; troubled וְקִטְרֵ֤י <S%H7001><s%> ve-kit-Rei him so that the joints חַרְצֵהּ֙ <S%H2783><s%> char-Tzeh of his loins מִשְׁתָּרַ֔יִן <S%H8271><s%> mish-ta-Ra-yin, were loosed וְאַ֨רְכֻבָּתֵ֔הּ <S%H755><s%> ve-'Ar-chub-ba-Teh, and his knees דָּ֥א <S%H1668><s%> da one לְדָ֖א <S%H1668><s%> le-Da against another נָֽקְשָֽׁן׃ <S%H5368><s%> Na-ke-Shan. smote

קָרֵ֤א <S%H7123><s%> ka-Re cried מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka The king בְּחַ֔יִל <S%H2429><s%> be-Cha-yil, aloud לְהֶֽעָלָה֙ <S%H5954><s%> le-he-'a-Lah to bring לְאָ֣שְׁפַיָּ֔א <S%H826><s%> le-'A-she-fai-Ya, in the astrologers; כַּשְׂדָּיֵא kas-da-ye ככַּשְׂדָּאֵ֖י <S%H3779><s%> kas-da-'Ei Chaldean קוְגָזְרַיָּ֑א <S%H1505><s%> ve-ga-ze-rai-Ya; and the soothsayers עָנֵ֨ה <S%H6032><s%> 'a-Neh spake מַלְכָּ֜א <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka [And] the king וְאָמַ֣ר׀ <S%H560><s%> ve-'a-Mar and said לְחַכִּימֵ֣י <S%H2445><s%> le-chak-ki-Mei to the wise בָבֶ֗ל <S%H895><s%> va-Vel, [men] of Babylon דִּ֣י <S%H1768><s%> di who כָל־ <S%H3606><s%> chol Any אֱ֠נָשׁ <S%H606><s%> 'E-nosh man דִּֽי־ <S%H1768><s%> di- who יִקְרֵ֞ה <S%H7123><s%> yik-Reh shall read כְּתָבָ֣ה <S%H3792><s%> ke-ta-Vah writing דְנָ֗ה <S%H1836><s%> de-Nah, this וּפִשְׁרֵהּ֙ <S%H6591><s%> u-fish-Reh me the interpretation יְחַוִּנַּ֔נִי <S%H2324><s%> ye-chav-vin-Na-ni, and shew אַרְגְּוָנָ֣א <S%H711><s%> 'ar-ge-va-Na with scarlet יִלְבַּ֗שׁ <S%H3848><s%> yil-Bash, thereof shall be clothed; וְהַמֹּונְכָא ve-ham-mon-cha כוְהַֽמְנִיכָ֤א <S%H2002><s%> ve-ham-ni-Cha chain קדִֽי־ <S%H1768><s%> di- who דַהֲבָא֙ <S%H1722><s%> da-ha-Va of gold עַֽל־ <S%H5922><s%> 'al- about צַוְּארֵ֔הּ <S%H6676><s%> tzav-ve-Reh, his neck וְתַלְתִּ֥י <S%H8523><s%> ve-tal-Ti and shall be the third בְמַלְכוּתָ֖א <S%H4437><s%> ve-mal-chu-Ta in the kingdom יִשְׁלַֽט׃ <S%H7981><s%> yish-Lat. ruler ס sa-Mek

אֱדַ֙יִן֙ <S%H116><s%> 'e-Da-yin Then; עָלֲלִין 'a-la-lin כעָֽלִּ֔ין <S%H5954><s%> 'al-Lin, bring in קכֹּ֖ל <S%H3606><s%> kol in all חַכִּימֵ֣י <S%H2445><s%> chak-ki-Mei wise מַלְכָּ֑א <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka; the king's וְלָֽא־ <S%H3809><s%> ve-la- not כָהֲלִ֤ין <S%H3546><s%> cha-ha-Lin [men] but they could כְּתָבָא֙ <S%H3792><s%> ke-ta-Va the writing לְמִקְרֵ֔א <S%H7123><s%> le-mik-Re, read; וּפִשְׁרָא u-fish-ra כוּפִשְׁרֵ֖הּ <S%H6591><s%> u-fish-Reh interpretation קלְהוֹדָעָ֥ה <S%H3046><s%> le-ho-da-'Ah nor make known לְמַלְכָּֽא׃ <S%H4430><s%> le-mal-Ka. to the king

אֱ֠דַיִן <S%H116><s%> 'E-da-yin Then מַלְכָּ֤א <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka was king בֵלְשַׁאצַּר֙ <S%H1113><s%> ve-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar שַׂגִּ֣יא <S%H7690><s%> sag-Gi greatly מִתְבָּהַ֔ל <S%H927><s%> mit-ba-Hal, troubled וְזִיוֹ֖הִי <S%H2122><s%> ve-zi-Yo-hi and his countenance שָׁנַ֣יִן <S%H8133><s%> sha-Na-yin was changed עֲל֑וֹהִי <S%H5922><s%> a-Lo-hi; in him וְרַבְרְבָנ֖וֹהִי <S%H7261><s%> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi and his lords מִֽשְׁתַּבְּשִֽׁין׃ <S%H7672><s%> Mish-tab-be-Shin. were astonied

מַלְכְּתָ֕א <S%H4433><s%> mal-ke-Ta [Now] the queen לָקֳבֵ֨ל <S%H6903><s%> lo-ko-Vel by reason מִלֵּ֤י <S%H4406><s%> mil-Lei of the words מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka of the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <S%H7261><s%> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his lords לְבֵ֥ית <S%H1005><s%> le-Veit house מִשְׁתְּיָ֖א <S%H4961><s%> mish-te-Ya into the banquet; עַלֲלַת 'a-la-lat כעַלַּ֑ת <S%H5954><s%> 'al-Lat; bring in קעֲנָ֨ת <S%H6032><s%> 'a-Nat spake מַלְכְּתָ֜א <S%H4433><s%> mal-ke-Ta [and] the queen וַאֲמֶ֗רֶת <S%H560><s%> va-'a-Me-ret, and said מַלְכָּא֙ <S%H4430><s%> mal-Ka O king לְעָלְמִ֣ין <S%H5957><s%> le-'al-Min for ever חֱיִ֔י <S%H2418><s%> che-Yi, live אַֽל־ <S%H409><s%> 'al- let not יְבַהֲלוּךְ֙ <S%H927><s%> ye-va-ha-luCh trouble רַעְיוֹנָ֔ךְ <S%H7476><s%> ra'-yo-Nach, thy thoughts וְזִיוָ֖יךְ <S%H2122><s%> ve-zi-Vaich thee nor let thy countenance אַל־ <S%H409><s%> 'al- not יִשְׁתַּנּֽוֹ׃ <S%H8133><s%> yish-tan-No. be changed
